keyword: calories in tonic water and vodka
title: Calories in Tonic Water and Vodka
meta_description: Discover calories in tonic water and vodka for a standard drink, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition tweaks for low-cal options.
h1: Calories in Tonic Water and Vodka
assumptions: Standard serving: 40 ml vodka (40% ABV), 200 ml regular tonic water, no ice, garnish, or added sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, tonic type (regular vs. diet), and mix ratios. Check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard vodka tonic provides ~221 kcal, mostly from the tonic's sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use soda water instead of tonic

faqs.q: How many calories in a vodka tonic?
faqs.a: About 221 kcal for 40 ml vodka and 200 ml regular tonic.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in tonic water and vodka?
faqs.a: Yes, ~30 g carbs from tonic's sugars; vodka adds none.
Around 97 kcal using diet tonic (zero-sugar version).

faqs.q: Does vodka add calories to tonic water?
faqs.a: Vodka contributes ~97 kcal from alcohol; tonic adds the rest.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in tonic water and vodka?
faqs.a: Opt for diet tonic, smaller pours, or club soda for ~97 kcal total.
